THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 7
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
Abnormal Flavors in Cream and Milk, P. S.
Lucas, Dept, of Dairy Husbandry.
Music.
Uncle Sam at Your Service.
Man and His Environment—Some Effects of
Muscular Activity in Physiological Functions,
J'. R. Stiefel, Dept, of Physiology.
Economic Legislation of the 74th Congress—The
Social Security Act, J. C. Davis, Dept, of Eco¬
nomics.
Music.
The Soil as a Living World, C. S. Bryan, Dept, of
Bacteriology.
History in the Making—America, E. B. Lyon,
Dept, of History.
The Campus Reporter, Jack Parker.
FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 8
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
Garden and Orchard Insects, Dept, of Entomology.
Music.
Character Training Through Habits, Catherine
Miller, Div. of Home Economics.
Michigan State College of the Air—Survey of
English Literature, E. P. Lawrence, Dept, of
English.
Music.
Adventures Abroad—Farming in Russia, E. B.
Hill, Dept, of Farm Management.
Spartan Sports in Review, Harry Wismer.
SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 9
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
4-H Club Program—Flashes from Alumni Mem¬
bers of the Campus 4-H Club, 4-H News.
Football—Marquette University vs. Michigan State
College (Homecoming).
MONDAY, NOVEMBER 11
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
The International Hay and Grain Show for 1935,
G. F. Wenner, Dept, of Farm Crops.
Rural Electrification, L. A. Walkling, Sec’y, Mich¬
igan Rural Electrification Ass’n.
Music—Julius Stulberg, Violin, Joe Evans, Piano.
The Health of the Farm Woman II, Div. of Home
Economics.
Michigan State College of the Air—Psychology
No. 5, J. M. DeHaan, Dept, of Psychology.
Music.
School and Government, E. L. Austin, Dept, of
Education.
Science News of the Week.
News of the Highways, Mott Heath, Michigan
State Highway Dept.
TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 12
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
Current Poultry Problems, F. N. Barrett, Dept.
of Poultry Husbandry.
Music.
Bee Inspection Service, Don P. Barrett, Michigan
State Dept, of Agriculture.
Michigan State College of the Air—Survey of
English Literature, E. P. Lawrence, Dept, of
English.
Music—Morris Hochberg, Violin.
Bacterial Death Rays, Mark Carpenter, Sigma
Alpha Beta, Bacteriology Fraternity.
Interesting Tree Stories, Karl Dressel, Dept, of
Forestry.
The Campus Reporter, Jack Parker.
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 13
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
Mulching Strawberries, R. E. Loree, Dept, of
Horticulture.
Music—WKAR Trio.
